longInfo:
Passport required. 
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of temporary passports.

Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Visitors traveling as tourist can
obtain a visa on arrival for a max. stay of 90 days. Fee:
between USD 25.- and USD 100.- or equivalent in convertible
currency.  (SEE NOTE 56906)
    NOTE 56906: Not applicable to holders of temporary
   passports, who must obtain a visa prior to travel.
- Visitors traveling on business can obtain a visa on arrival
  for a max. stay of 5 years, provided holding a license
  issued by the Ministry of Industry. Fee: between USD 100.-
  and USD 300.- or equivalent in convertible currency.  (SEE
  NOTE 56906)
    NOTE 56906: Not applicable to holders of temporary
   passports, who must obtain a visa prior to travel.
Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Netherlands will be expected
  to hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Those not leaving the airport in the countries with risk of
  yellow fever transmission. 
Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P. vivax,
  exists throughout the year in rural areas of the Terai
  districts bordering with India, with occasional outbreaks of
  P. falciparum from July to October inclusive. Seasonal
  transmission of P. vivax takes place in districts of the
  inner Terai and midhills. Recommended prevention in risk
  areas: C.
